entry.tran: 黏性的;涂有黏性物质的
entry.def: A sticky substance is soft, or thick and liquid, and can stick to other things. Sticky things are covered with a sticky substance.

example.ex: If the dough is sticky, add more flour...
example.tran: 如果面团太黏，就再加点面粉。

entry.def: A sticky situation involves problems or is embarrassing.

example.ex: Inevitably the transition will yield some sticky moments...
example.tran: 过渡时期难免会出现一些困难的时候。

example.ex: Her research was going through a sticky patch.
example.tran: 她的研究工作正处于一个艰难的阶段。

entry.def: Sticky weather is unpleasantly hot and damp.

example.ex: ...four desperately hot, sticky days in the middle of August.
example.tran: 8 月中旬极其闷热的 4 天

entry.def: If someone comes to a sticky end or meets a sticky end, they suffer very badly or die in an unpleasant way.

example.ex: Arminius also came to a sticky end, murdered by his own troops.
example.tran: 阿米尼乌斯也死得很惨，被自己的部下害死了。

means.word_mean: 1. the property of sticking to a surface

auth_sentence.content: Obscure shows can show surprising stickiness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Obscure shows can show surprising stickiness.

auth_sentence.content: But the natural stickiness of the markets means they do not have to.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the natural stickiness of the markets means they do not have to.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the natural stickiness of the markets means they do not have to.

auth_sentence.content: Leather binding has subtle magnetic clasps that provide a little stickiness when closed.
auth_sentence.res_content: Leather binding has subtle magnetic clasps that provide a little stickiness when closed.
